description:
Very short. Worth doing once. Like a little via ferrata.

This is commercially run canyon. Please be considerate of commercial trips that may in the canyon and avoid doing it during commercial operating hours. Consider talking to Canyon Explorers in Queenstown to check if they will have a group running through.

Water quality is not great. Won't due you any harm (maybe), but it's not the usual Haast Pass quality.

Approach

Park considerately for the winery visitors and the commercial canyoner shelters. Don gear in the parking lot.

Walk down the river and through the river tunnel under the road. Follow under the footbridge for the "Gibbston River Trail". Scramble easily out of the river true left to the River Trail, then cross the footbridge to now be river right. Turn left at the fork, follow the path above the river. Turn down left back into the river at the second picnic table.

Although the above may sound confusing, it's obvious when there, and can all be seen on Google Maps satellite view.

Descent

Follow the canyon. Be respectful of the installed hardware and ropes.

Exit

When the canyon section ends, scramble out left, follow the level path, then follow the Gibbston River Trail back to the start.

Run across the road with caution.
